title: Useful Geometry Formulas
alt: Geometry textbooks always try to trick you by adding decorative stripes and dotted lines.
transcript: [Four figures in two rows of two, each depicts a two-dimensional representation of a three-dimensional object, with some labeled dimensions represented as arrows and a formula underneath indicating its area]Useful geometry formulas[Top left; a sphere with its radius labeled r][Top right; a cone with its height h. The ellipse in place of the base has semi-minor axis a and semi-major axis b][Bottom left; a cylinder with height h. The ellipses have semi-minor axis r and semi-major axis d][Bottom right; a prism with width b, height h, depth d. The base has an angle Î¸]
